channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fence panel broken and rubbish dumped, 19th January
item.description:
The fence was loose but not broken, it has been pulled away from its frame and leant against our garage wall, personal rubbish has been left in bags, alongside a broken cabinet and some other debris. May have personal details in but don’t want to open the bags for safety reasons. Could the fence be repaired and a proper gap be created so residents can access the green belt from the car park at the end of the road? The hedge line on the green belt side of the fence is also so overgrown you cannot walk down to the next part of the estate like you used to be able to - it’s now a dead end of ivy and brambles which a large machine would need to clear as it’s so dense.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes in lane 2 on Lansdown Rd, 19th January
item.description:
There are a series of quite deep potholes on Lansdown Rd just after the Hatherley Rd junction. They are in the right hand lane and cause traffic to veer into the other lane
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Approximately 7.5 inches deep outside 167 Ermin Street., 18th January
item.description:
It is located in the right hand side of the heading towards the petrol station cross hands round about and before the one shop. It is perfectly located where the right wheel sits if you drive in the middle of the road correctly. As I was driving towards the roundabout at legal appropriate speed limit. The whole drivers side wheel sank into the extreme pot hole causing the car to become unstable and cause me high stress and panic. My steering was completely compromised and I luckily managed to pull over in the car park of one stop. After stopping the tyre was completely flat. After removing the wheel off the car it was clear that it was dented and seriously damaged and weakened and irreparable and the tyre will need to be replaced to ensure it’s safe after going through that amount of force and shock.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Street, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: I sustained a blow out of my tyre on the evening of 16th Jan at 17:30. The pot hole is very deep and long and unmarked. It made me scream out in shock ., 18th January
item.description:
You pass Crippets Lane in your left and the long pot hole is in the middle aspect of the road unfilled and unmarked. There are other potholes that have obviously been filled with tarmac.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury

item.title: The road drain is blocked but i've seen water coming out the drain so believe the main pipe for the ditch drain is blocked leading to all the water that should go into the river ending up blocking the road., 18th January
item.description:
The blockage has been a problem for near a year now. It's not just blocked as water leaves the road, the pipe from the ditch to I think the river is blocked or collapsed ending up with all the ditch water flooding out of the road drains into the road and remaining there. Please help as you can no longer walk down the road and it doesn't clear.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
